question: Convection can occur inside a star. This stellar convection describes motion of gas. If we consider a star as an ideal gas. Choose the right statement representing stellar convection in which a packet of gas rises slightly

choices.label: The gas cools to a lower temperature than its new surroundings, so that it has a higher density than surroundings, it will continue to rise.
The temperature gradient of the gas is steep enough and the density is less dense than its new surroundings, then the gas will sink back again.
The gas cools to a lower temperature than its new surroundings, but its density is the same with surroundings. This makes the gas continues to rise.
If the temperature gradient of the gas is steep enough, the gas is less dense than its new surroundings, and it will continue to rise.
The gas has higher temperature and higher density than surroundings, so it will sink back again to where it comes from.
